definition: to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: I don't know how we'll get in.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道我们怎么才能潜进去。

sentences.english: He looked distraught with nausea He spit it out and dived into the swimming pool to wash out his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他全吐了出来，然后潜进游泳池中冲洗自己的嘴。

sentences.english: The wanted man dived into an alley to escape from the police.
sentences.chinese: 那个通缉犯潜进一条小巷躲避警察的追捕。

sentences.english: I love to play. Do you? I can dive to the depths of the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢玩，你呢？我可以潜进很深的海中。

sentences.english: You put the policy of benevolence and the teaching of philanthropy into Chinese people's mind.
sentences.chinese: 你把仁政博爱之道之礼，潜进炎黄子孙的思维。

sentences.english: The other night after dinner, I caught him sneaking into the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 某天晚上晚饭后，我发现他偷偷潜进厨房。

sentences.english: Perhaps may magnificently to big on South Pole, or dives the oceanic trench.
sentences.chinese: 没准可以辉煌到大上南极，或者潜进海沟。

sentences.english: The Raven Queen provides a method for the adventurers to travel into Death's Reach.
sentences.chinese: 鸦后保留著某个能够让冒险者们潜进死亡岬的方法。

sentences.english: He dives into the Chen Fu, found a girl in his former room.
sentences.chinese: 他潜进陈府，在自己以前的房间发现了丫头。

pinyin: shen2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: submerged piles installed to prevent the passage of boats/(fig.) informer/spy
to slink/to move stealthily/to advance through the water
to conceal oneself/to go into hiding/to take cover
to spy upon/to lie in wait for (an opportunity)

pinyin: ren2 bu4 zhi1 gui3 bu4 jue2

definition: the whole nest came out (idiom); to turn out in full strength
